alert.note: Alert for Custer (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 02 at 2:58AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Montana, including the following county, Custer. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - 1 to 2.5 inches of rainfall is possible in portions of the watch area by Saturday morning. Locally heavier accumulations are possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
